content.prompt: A particle moves along the x-axis so that at any time t > 0 , its velocity is given by  v ( t ) = 4 âˆ’ 6 t 2 . If the particle is at position x=7 at t = 1 time, what is the position of the particle at time t=2 ?

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
